etymology.description: Phonetic: 九(九) (jiǔ, "nine") + Semantic: 日(日) (rì, "sun") = phonetic and semantic component combined to suggest the notion of the sun rising -> rising sun; dawn
etymology.interpretation: 旭(旭) (xù, "rising sun") effectively combines 日(日) (rì, "sun") to denote the sun with 九(九) (jiǔ, "nine") for phonetic purposes, reflecting the idea of a rising sun and the beginning of the day.

examples.chinese: 晨曦初露之时(晨曦初露之時)，旭日东升(旭日東升)。
examples.pinyin: Chénxī chūlù zhī shí, xùrì dōngshēng.
examples.english: When the dawn first appears, the rising sun ascends.

examples.chinese: 我站在山顶(我站在山頂)，凝望着旭光万丈(凝望著旭光萬丈)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhàn zài shāndǐng, níngwàng zhe xùguāng wànzhàng.
examples.english: I stand on the mountaintop, gazing at the magnificent sunrise.

examples.chinese: 旭日初升映红天边(旭日初升映紅天邊)。
examples.english: The rising sun paints the horizon in red.
